actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to make the excuse of prospective jurors from Federal jury service on the grounds of distance from the place of holding court contingent upon a showing of hardship on an individual basis.

summary.text: Repeals the requirement of the Jury Selection and Service Act of 1968 that the written plan for jury selection of each United State district court fix a distance, either in terms of mileage or travel time, beyond which prospective jurors may automatically be excused from traveling for jury duty.

titles.title: A bill to make the excuse of prospective jurors from Federal jury service on the grounds of distance from the place of holding court contingent upon a showing of hardship on an individual basis.
